articles.description: A small but key UK study has found that "cellular immunity" to the pandemic SARS-CoV-2 virus is present after six months in people who had mild or asymptomatic COVID-19 - suggesting they might have some level of protection for at least that time.
articles.content: LONDON (Reuters) - A small but key UK study has found that cellular immunity to the pandemic SARS-CoV-2 virus is present after six months in people who had mild or asymptomatic COVID-19 - suggesting … [+2859 chars]

articles.author: Matt Atherton
articles.title: COVID: Scientists report T-cell immunity in major boost - 'Cautiously optimistic' - Express
articles.description: COVID UK: Coronavirus cases continue to rise across the country, as Boris Johnson announces a second nationwide lockdown to curb the spread of the infection. But scientists are 'cautiously optimistic' after a new study showed that patients may have a level of…

articles.author: By Lucy Hunter Jessica Green For Mailonline
articles.title: Women with secondary breast cancer 'ignored' by charities and NHS - Daily Mail
articles.description: From being labelled the 'angels of death' to feeling guilty for not 'winning their battle', British patients suffering with the incurable condition have revealed why they're campaigning for more awareness.
articles.content:
They are the women who are dying from secondary breast cancer - but feel ignored by the charities set out to help them.
From being labelled the 'angels of death' to being made to feel guilty for not… [+12685 chars]

articles.author: Dr. Sanjay Gupta and Andrea Kane, CNN
articles.title: The 'dose' of coronavirus a person gets may determine how sick they get; masks could help - CNN
articles.description: "The dose makes the poison" is an adage credited to Paracelsus, a Swiss physician-philosopher from the early Renaissance.
